intro.description:
The 'Project Explorer' is the most useful part of the workbench. Here you have projects of different types, such as python.
If you cannot see the 'Project Explorer' part go to:
Window->Show View->Project Explorer

item.title: Python Projects
item.description:
As seen in order tutorials, you can create projects for python code which will import to other machines. Right click in the Project Explorer and go to:
New->Other...->PyDev->PyDev Project
Press 'Next' and call the new project 'python_scripts'. Specify that a Jython interpreter should be used and that the project should have a 'src' directory. If you see a pop-up dialog for creating an interpreter then please cancel it.

item.title: Sub-folders
item.description: The projects created may have sub-folders added and files imported so you can organize your data, workflows and python scripts. Try right clicking on your project and using the 'New' menu to create a folder.

item.title: Export Data Wizard
item.description:
You can right click on any project and go to:
Export...->General->Archive File
The resulting zip file exported can be imported again back at the lab. Note links to data are followed by this process so you can obtain very large zip files. Do not forget to backup python and workflows, which may take time to develop, regularly.
Click below to start the export data wizard and give this a try.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: Congratulations, you can now organize things in multiple projects with different roles. Try finding the 'Data' project type and adding links to data in it.
